TITLE.P: Panel of Service Providers for International Student Recruitment — 3 lots

SHORT_DESCR.P: Dundalk Institute of Technology invites applications from appropriately qualified service providers to facilitate recruitment of international students in China, Malaysia and Saudi Arabia. DkIT will establish three panels one for each region as follows:

Lot 1 — China; Lot 2 — Malaysia; Lot 3 — Saudi Arabia. Applicants can apply at any time over the next three years, however in order to be considered for immediate opportunities applicants are encouraged to complete the application process by the initial closing date for applications.

TITLE.P: Lot 1 — China — International Student Recruitment — 3 lots

MAIN_SITE.P: Internationally for delivery to Dundalk Co. Louth.

SHORT_DESCR.P: This lot relates to recruitment of students for Dundalk Institute of Technology in China.

INFO_ADD.P: Additional information is contained in the documentation available to download from www.etenders.gov.ie using RFT ID 130570. Suppliers must be registered on etenders in order to view / download the documentation and also in order to receive all clarifications issued.

MAIN_SITE.P: Internationally for delivery to Dundalk, Co. Louth

SHORT_DESCR.P: This lot relates to recruitment of students for Dundalk Institute of Technology in Malaysia.

INFO_ADD.P: Additional information is contained in the documentation available to download from www.etenders.gov.ie using RFT ID 130570. Suppliers must be registered on etenders in order to view / download the documentation and also in order to receive all clarifications issued.

TITLE.P: Lot 3 — Saudi Arabia — International Student Recruitment

MAIN_SITE.P: Internationally for delivery to Dundalk, Co. Louth

SHORT_DESCR.P: This lot relates to recruitment of students for Dundalk Institute of Technology in Saudi Arabia.

INFO_ADD.P: Additional information is contained in the documentation available to download from www.etenders.gov.ie using RFT ID 130570. Suppliers must be registered on etenders in order to view / download the documentation and also in order to receive all clarifications issued.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: Please refer to the qualifictation questionnaire available to download from www.etenders.gov.ie using RFT ID 130570.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Will be agreed with successful service providers.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: The procedure involves the establishment of 3 panels of qualified firms, one panel of firms for each lot. Applicants should initially complete and submit, via www.etenders.gov.ie the qualification questionnaire. All applicants will be evaluated and all those who meet the minimum criteria will be admitted to the panel.

INFO_ADD.P: 1) Interested parties must register their interest on the eTenders web site (www.etenders.gov.ie) in order to be included on the mailing list for clarifications. All information relating to attachments, including clarifications and changes, will be published on the Irish Government Procurement Opportunities Portal (www.etenders.gov.ie) only. Registration is free of charge. The contracting authority will not accept responsibility for information relayed (or not relayed) via third parties:
2) The contracting authority will not be responsible for any costs, charges or expenses incurred by candidates or tenderers.
3) Contract award(s) will be subject to the approval of the competent authorities.
4) It will be a condition of award that the successful tenderer is and remains tax compliant.
5) At its absolute discretion, the contracting authority may elect to terminate this procurement process, or any contract awarded under the framework agreement at any time.

6) Without prejudice to the principle of equal treatment, the contracting authority is not obliged to engage in a clarification process in respect of the procurement documents with missing or incomplete information. Therefore, respondents are advised to ensure that they return completed documentation in order to avoid the risk of elimination from the competition.

7) As the service in question is a Title III — Social and other specific service, the contracting authority is employing a procedure involving negotiations. Admittance to the panel does not guarantee the award of any contract. The Contracting Authority reserves the right to award contracts to one or more firms on the panel.

8) The panel will operate for a maximum period of three years. Applicants should respond, if possible, prior to the initial closing date. Applicants who miss that deadline may submit a manual application to the email detailed in the qualification questionnaire.
